meanings.definition: An establishment for the medical treatment of people who are convalescing or have a chronic illness.
meanings.sent1: The small town had a sanitariums where patients could recover from their illnesses.
meanings.sent2: My grandmother stayed at the sanitariums to get better after her surgery.
meanings.sent3: The sanitariums was so peaceful that some patients joked about never wanting to leave.
meanings.sent4: The sanitariums became a safe harbor for those seeking solace from their ailments.
meanings.sent5: The white walls of the sanitariums seemed to promise healing to all who entered.

meanings.definition: A facility for the care and treatment of individuals with mental health disorders.
meanings.sent1: The city built a new sanitariums to provide better care for those with mental health issues.
meanings.sent2: The sanitariums had specialized programs to help patients manage their mental health conditions.
meanings.sent3: Some movies portray sanitariums as spooky places, but in reality, they are centers of healing.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a chaotic sanitariums, with thoughts running wild and unchecked.
meanings.sent5: The sanitariums offered a sanctuary for those struggling with their inner demons.

meanings.definition: A place for the treatment of tuberculosis patients.
meanings.sent1: In the early 1900s, many sanitariums were established to treat tuberculosis.
meanings.sent2: Doctors recommended that the patient be admitted to a sanitariums for specialized care.
meanings.sent3: The old sanitariums had a vintage charm that made it feel like a time capsule.
meanings.sent4: The fight against tuberculosis was waged in the quiet halls of the sanitariums.
meanings.sent5: The fresh mountain air surrounding the sanitariums was believed to aid in the patients' recovery.
